revised_title: The Influence of Arterial Wall Lability on Blood Pressure and Pulse Curve
tldr: This study investigates the effect of the 'lability' (resilience) of the arterial wall on blood pressure and pulse curve. The authors found that the nature of the arterial wall significantly affects the conduction of pressure waves, influencing the shape of sphygmograms and arterial pressure readings taken with a sphygmomanometer.
